decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5 and ES6, Replacement UDP Policy 4.1. | The car parking space(s) shown on the approved plan No. 0227/02 REV A shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose. 	 REASON:	To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking  within the site, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies T50 and T63, Replacement UDP Policies 9.11 and 9.12. | The extension permitted shall not be used or occupied at any time other than for purposes ancillary to the residential use of the dwelling known as 59 Langdale Gardens, Greenford, Middlesex, UB6 8DQ.  REASON:	To ensure that the character of the area is preserved and a separate dwelling is not created, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5 and H11, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1 and 5.6.
